Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, everybody. This is your last meal, so eat up. [cheering]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: From this point forward, you will not use the bathroom. We need to keep our starting weights high so we can lose more.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This summer, corporate is sponsoring a little weight loss contest between the branches. Whichever branch loses the most weight gets three extra vacation days.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What should we do with all these leftovers?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm taking the dumplings for my wife.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no. This is your last meal. There will be no leftovers.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I can bring these to my shelter.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm taking my dumplings.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sprays food with bug poison] There. Take those home to your wife.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, it's time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hit the scales, everybody. Right on that black platform. This way. Step it up.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Don't go breaking my scale.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm excited to lose weight for the wedding, because I really want to have washboard abs the first time Angela sees me naked.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Ex-squeeze me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I will ex-squeeze you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK everybody. Get used to this because we are going to be standing here briefly every Monday for the next seven Mondays.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait a minute. One more bite of eclair each. Hold it in your mouth if you can't swallow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [smiles, looks to Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm totally gonna slaughter at the weigh-in today.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: All I had this weekend to eat was a chicken breast and a case of Diet Coke.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Really? 'Cause I haven't eaten anything since noon on Friday.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: OK. [holds elevator] Stanley, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, I forgot something in my car. I'll see you guys up there. [takes the stairs after the elevator doors close]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I happen to be losing weight on my own for my own reasons. The truth is, I have lost a little of my speed, a little of my fire. Here's what I used to look like. [holds up old photo] Look at those biceps. We were fighting the power and eating whatever we wanted.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: And arch your back. And slowly bring up your head. [Michael and Holly face each other in yoga pose]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jimbo.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, they moved the shower.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you see Holly's butt?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I didn't. [Michael laughs] You know why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Because most of the time, friends don't talk about other friends' butts.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But what have you learned about her?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I learned that she broke her left leg twice in one year. I learned that she's allergic to sesame seeds. I learned that she has read "Lonesome Dove" three times.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And that her butt refuses to quit!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I tried. [Michael laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [follows Jim into bathroom] You have to agree with me. [follows Jim back out] That's insane.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll just go later.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I thought you had to pee.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [forces candy out of vending machine and forces fruit into racks]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, if you're into yoga, I take a great bikram class in Dickson City.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks. I should check that out.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Also -- and no pressure -- the teacher? He's a catch.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Actually, I'm a lesbian.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm gay!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I'm not a lesbian. I don't know why I said that... It's a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What's the joke?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: There is no joke. I just said it because I haven't had much luck lately and I'm not really looking to date. Maybe I should switch to women.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, you think it's a choice?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Um, I'm gonna head back to my work area and just-

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm messing with you, Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I knew that. OK, bye.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So you have the directions.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You have a toothbrush.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You have a cell phone charger.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have everything.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Tomorrow I start a three-month design program at the Pratt Institute in New York. I will be a little fish in the big apple. [does hand gesture] What up, 212?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fax this for me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on, man. She goes to New York in like 10 minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not gonna take her 10 minutes to fax it, Jim. [to Pam] If I don't see you again, goodbye. Well, actually, I'll see you when you give me the fax confirmation, so never mind.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ang. Ela. [sings] Ella, ella, ella. Under my Angerela. Ella, ella, ella. Ay, ay-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, check it out. [hands her brochure] This is The Breakers, Newport, Rhode Island. Huge, awesome gorgeous mansion overlooking the Atlantic. And my dad went to Cornell with the current groundskeeper.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Every little boy fantasizes about his fairy-tale wedding.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is where my parents decided not to get divorced.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't care.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: OK. How do you feel about Maine? [Angela picks up phone and dials] I'm on it. I'll see you later, love. [Dwight's pager vibrates, he and Angela walk out]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [exiting warehouse storage room] Ahh. We done good in there, half pint.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, that was the last time, Dwight. I mean it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Monkey. [kisses her]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, no. I have a fiance I very much like!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sees Pam and Jim through office window, runs out the office] Hey, hey! [falls down stairs, gets up, falls down again] Pam, Pam! Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What happened?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [frazzled and out of breath] I wrote you a goodbye poem. It's really long. I left it up in my office. Could you just please wait till I go get it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I should really get going.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. OK. Um, the last word is "seagulls."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sure it was really lovely.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I took a lot from other poems.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Call me when you get in. [kisses Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK, bye.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, call- [leans in to kiss Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why haven't I proposed yet? Uh, actually Pam and I talked about it. And we just decided that, um -- well, we didn't want to spend first three months of our engagement apart. And Pam's always said she doesn't want a long engagement. Something in her past, I guess. I'm not really sure of the whole story, but something about a guy who used to work here...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, no, no, no, no, no, no. Same places as last week.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It doesn't matter, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, it does. No, this is about weight displacement. We have to have the same weight distribution. Right here. Here we go. Let's move that up. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, fancy meeting you here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: OK, everybody smile. Ho! You lost 31 pounds.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't believe I'm saying this, but Michael is actually killing it with Holly. And I think I know why. It's because Holly is kind of a major dork.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [rapping] I'm MC Mike Scott, and I am hot. She's DJ Jazzy Flax, and she is the best. All those sucker branches can suck our fat!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Wikka wikka wikka what?

Quote.Speaker: Ronnie
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Ronnie.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't really know Ronnie. But I have a feeling I will get to know her very well over the next few years, and eventually declare my love for her.

Quote.Speaker: Professor
Quote.Text: Sorry I'm late. I accidentally switched my alarm clock setting to Zapf Chancery. [laughter] Which is my terrible segue into our course, Expressive Typography in New Media.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm in the wrong class...

Quote.Speaker: Professor
Quote.Text: Some of you may remember from last semester I am Professor Monaghan. [sees Pam leaving] And looks like I'm boring someone already.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no. I just-

Quote.Speaker: Professor
Quote.Text: Please sit down.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: You're shaking. Are you all right?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Just leave me alone!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [sickly] I am on the third day of my cleanse diet. All I have to do is drink maple syrup, lemon juice, cayenne pepper and water for all three meals. Um, I just bought some bikinis online, size 2. So ... gonna look amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Ronnie
Quote.Text: Hi, can I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I need you to make me 100 copies of this on canary yellow.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hi Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: How's the candle game?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, great. Yeah, Serenity by Jan is kicking ass and taking names. You remember last week when that girl went missing? Guess whose candles they used for the vigil?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Cool. Thank God they found her, too.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, they found her?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi, Jan. Hello, baby. How are you? Good to see you. Who's your daddy? You don't know who your daddy is, do you? No, you don't. [to Jan] Come on. Let's go in.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: When Michael told us that Jan was pregnant, he led us to believe that he was the father. By telling us that he was the father.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hey, Oscar. Who's that woman in Michael's office with the feet?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: That's his ex.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, she's very beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yes, she is. And clinically insane.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: So, listen, I don't know if your offer still stands or whatever, but you can give your yoga teacher my number.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Listen, dummy! It's not that hard. All you have to do is take the numbers from the sales report and type them into a master spreadsheet. A G.D. monkey could do it. I do not understand why you can't do it.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No! You do not talk to him like that!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: But he's an idiot!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: He is not an idiot!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Thank you, Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: He is mentally challenged. But he's doing a super job here.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait, back up. Do you think that I am retarded?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Well, no. Dwight...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, Holly, that is very offensive.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey. So, since my little lady has such particular, impossible to perceive taste, I have made nonrefundable deposits at four totally different wedding locales: Hot-air balloons over Napa Valley, world-famous Walt Disney's Epcot Center, scuba-diving wedding in the Bahamas and the Wilkes-Barre Marriott Ballroom C.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dangerous. Tacky. Sharks. Haunted. No.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [walking into storage room] Hurry, we have to make this fast.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's do this thing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Dwight slaps her butt] Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have a nice comforter and several cozy pillows. I usually read a chapter of a book, and it's lights out by 8:30. That's how I sleep at night!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, I am connecting and ... you are not there. Did you install it right? How about this: Go to applications-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on computer screen] I can see you!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is so cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So what is going on, girl in the computer?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Lunch with a girl from my hall.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ceramics class. Then dinner by myself. I'm gonna watch HGTV and maybe go to Bungalow 8 with John Mayer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, can you turn the girl off please? I'm trying to get some work done.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No way. No way. Pam Beesley. Hello. [picks up computer] Hey, everybody look, Pam. Pam, say hi. Say hi to Pam. Don't we all look skinny? Oh, oh, almost dropped you!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can you put me down I'm getting a little nauseous?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, I'd like you to meet Ronnie. We call her Rice-a-Ronnie. She is hilarious. She is wonderful, a beam of light in this dark, dark office. Not really so much. All she does is plop herself down there and answer phones all day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The nerve.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, calm down, weirdo. It's just a joke. She's such a weirdo! You know what? My real beef with her, though, Pam? She can't find those little colored paper clips that I like so much. Will you help her find them, please?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They're on the supply shelf.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's go. We are following Pam to the supply shelf. Let us go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: New York is so exciting. I love my classes. The city's awesome. Um, can you give me back to Jim now, please?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, everybody, let's suck in our guts.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: 2,184 pounds, for a grand total -- oh! You all gained five pounds back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Damn it. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [Kelly faints] Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, my God!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on, Bernard. [Andy spits on floor as warehouse worker walks past]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go. Everybody on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right, we're set.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Still good. You guys lost a pound. You lost one pound.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I was on an IV for two days at the hospital.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I lost four pounds. I don't know what those other fools were doing, but I lost four pounds.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Angela, you'll go to the supermarket and get the New York cheesecake. Make sure it's the generic one. It's Stanley's favorite.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes, I've replaced Angela as head of the party planning committee. [footage of Dwight and Angela making out] I guess I was just in the right place at the right time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How's it going?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's going well.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I have a crazy idea. What if we did, um, fruit instead of cake?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cake? Who suggested cake? [Angela points to Phyllis]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We lost weight today. I think it's OK to reward ourselves once in a while.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me? We only lost one pound, Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is wrong with these people? They have no willpower. I went -- I once went 28 years without having sex. And then again for seven years.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Does anyone have any idea what the number one cause of death is in this country?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shotgun weddings.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's not what that is.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Fright. Being scared to death.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Obesity-caused illnesses.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Obesity-caused illnesses.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you. Holly is right. People, this is not just about winning some extra vacation days. This is about a very cool HR initiative that if we don't follow, we are all going to die of obesity. So how much are we gonna lose?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I would like to lose 65 pounds.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, all right. Who else? [to Angela] Can I put you down for 10 pounds?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. My doctor wants me to gain weight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you gain weight, you will die. I want you to live forever. I want us all to live forever. How? How are we going to do this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cryogenics. Beer me five.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is how we're gonna do it. Five pounds. I'm asking each of you to lose five pounds. That plus Jim's 65 will give us a very good chance at winning this thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, I'm taking off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Booty call.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope, just going to see Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Maybe put up some shelves.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait a second. [removes condom from wallet, throws it to Jim] I don't want you to end up with a surprise pregnancy like me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, thank you for ... this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You want more?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't know if there's any one place that has all these things.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's not my problem. [dials phone]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thousand-year-old church in the continental United States. There has to be a rainbow. 24-hour veterinarian on call.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That is very important to me, so -- I have work to do. Just do it. [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sweetheart. [Angela turns around] Just so you know, I don't care where we get married. I'll marry you right here in this building. I'll marry you in the parking lot. I'll marry you in the eye of a hurricane in the middle of a snowstorm on top of a monsoon. All I care about is that we're gonna spend the rest of our lives together.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Angela kisses him] Hey-oh!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I know I haven't made this easy on you. [Dwight comes out of storage room alone, looks at watch.]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [knocks on door] Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi. [they kiss] Mmm. 'Cause- [looks toward camera]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, that's so rude of me. Have you seen, um, Pam's new art? It's right there. Check it out. [closes door]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [music playing] It's a pretty lame party.

Quote.Speaker: Ronnie
Quote.Text: Does anyone want to dance?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [watching baseball game on TV] Some girl came into Pam's room crying about her roommate stealing her soy milk. So I'm in here waiting it out.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Stanley, Michael's not here. You can eat a slice of your birthday cake.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't like cake anymore

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why not, dawg?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Tastes changed. Now all I like is baklava.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael, we have a situation.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They should not be in that room.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: That's so lame they didn't invite us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what we should do? We should have a party and not invite them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's go mini-golfing.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hey, could I have a rain check on the mini-golf. I, uh, actually have a date tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: It'll probably be a total disaster, but...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, I think you'll have fun. Men from Scranton are handsome, and they know how to show a woman a good time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not that guy who murdered his mother. He was not so handsome. Also Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? We're pretty much done here today. Why don't you just take off early?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, that's sweet. Wish me luck.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, Holly doesn't need luck. Everyone that meets her instantly loves her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Party's over. You are so busted!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, everybody. Phyllis, did I or did I not say fruit?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You said fruit, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And what is that?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Cake.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, we're gonna have to try a little harder if we are going to win this thing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Happy Birthday, Stanley! [kicks cake onto Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: It's kind of a good news, bad news situation. The bad news is we're not doing very well, so we really had to starve ourselves this whole week. But the good news is that all the other branches are doing just as bad as we are, so corporate upped the prize to five days. So if we stay fat long enough, we may actually get a whole month off.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [spreading peanut butter on a bagel] What?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's just some of us are taking this really seriously.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I swallowed a tapeworm last night. It's going to grow up to three feet inside of me and then it eats all my food so that I don't get fat. And then after three months I take some medicine and then I pass it. Creed sold it to me. It's from Mexico.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: That wasn't a tapeworm.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [walks in the office] How's my favorite branch doing? [no one talks, everyone stares at Ryan] All right [sits at reception].

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ronnie was bleh. Things were at an all time sad here. But then I got an e-mail from Ryan, that he was coming back to town. And I called the temp agency and I told them I will pay you any amount, just give me Ryan Howard. Give him to me. I want him. I need him.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: And you got a goatee!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Did you get that after you helped me move and you saw mine?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Gooooo-tee!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Firrrrre-duh guy! [high fives Ryan]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey Kevin... [Kevin gives Ryan a noogie] That's really funny.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's great to see you Kev.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You too.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm keeping a list... of everyone who wrongs me. So when I'm back on top, they'll be sorry. Kevin just made the list.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Jim. I wanted to apologize... for how I treated you last year. I lost sight of myself and now that I've quit the rat race I've realized there's so much more to life than being the youngest VP in the company's history. I've even started volunteering. Giving back to the community.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well that's great. [shakes Ryan's hand] You're talking about your court ordered community service?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't need a judge to tell me to keep my community clean.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But he did, right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [glares into the camera and writes Jim's name on his list]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Well you lost zero pounds. [everyone grumbles] No change. On the bright side you gained zero pounds.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, you know what? I can't do this by myself people! Kelly and I are the only ones who have either passed out or almost passed out. [flails his arms]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Damnit, I need these five days for my honeymoon! Who is slacking?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Ok, let's just all try and work harder, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: NO! I want names!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is the hardest thing I've ever had to do in my entire life. I haven't had a very hard life.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So how was your date?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Eight point five. I got a red wine stain on my favorite shirt. But he's cute, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [groans painfully]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What's wrong?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [struggling to speak] Mmm-- mmm... Um...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Close the door. This is your fault.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Your stupid friend zone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I should have been lovers with her first and then friends. That was terrible advice. Terrible advice! You know my seduction method. I like to get in there and get my hands dirty! Wh-- You sabotaged me. You sabotaged me, man!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Attention! Attention! We only have a few weeks left. [looking at Phyllis] And most of you are just as fat as the day we began.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How much weight have you lost, Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am hardly the problem, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, you're definitely the problem.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is what I'm gonna do. I'm gonna randomly select three names and these three people will get liposuction. Uhhhhh Stanley, Phyllis, Kevin. And you will be responsible for your own medical bills.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, hello Ryan. You look well.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I wanted to say I'm sorry... for treating you bad the past couple years. I was in my mid twenties and I was goin' through a lot of stuff. I think I never fully processed 9/11. Um, I want you to know I've changed.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We should get a drink later. Catch up. Pick me up around eight?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh that is so sweet. Um, but I'm dating Darryl, still, and we're like crazy in love so...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That-- I, um... cool. Well maybe I'll see you around.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: It's a small office.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello Phyllis. Do you have a minute? Listen. I'm really sorry... about what I said before. Ok? I was way out of line.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yes you were.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But you know what, I want to make it up to you. There is a sure fire sale, but it's a two man job. Interested?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Split the commission?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs] Sixty - forty. Hm? [they shake hands] I'll drive.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [exhales, camera shows Kelly and Darryl making out on the reception couch, Kelly looking at Ryan]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Dieting's only half of it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm-hmm. Saunas.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: And exercise. Although I know everybody loves going to the gym.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Gah, the dreadmill. [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Probably the weirdest thing about Pam being gone would be lunch... actually. But um, it will force me to become acquaintances with people I consider... coworkers.

Quote.Speaker: Friend
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. Ok. Everybody just act normal. Don't say anything.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Friend
Quote.Text: My ex-girlfriend. She's right behind you. Just... hide me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really, where?

Quote.Speaker: Friend
Quote.Text: No no! Don't look! [Pam sees an old lady behind him]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow, was it the age difference?

Quote.Speaker: Friend
Quote.Text: Uh, actually, kind of. Yes. I just didn't like eating dinner that early. [they laugh, Pam's phone rings, she answers]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey! Jim! Um, listen, can I call you back in a little bit? I made friends!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [storms in the office, sweaty and out of breath] Are you insane?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, hey!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh my God, what happened?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: There was no client. Dwight drove me to an abandoned warehouse five miles away and pushed me out of the car. I had to walk home with no money and no phone.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And you burned over a thousand calories walking home. And this branch just got a little bit closer to winning the contest. Phyllis Vance, ladies and gentlemen! [claps]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You left me in a bad part of town!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, I took your purse. What are you worried about? [Phyllis storms to her desk, picks up phone and dials] You look great. I can definitely see the difference.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [into phone] Phyllis Vance for David Wallace.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: "...or that Dunder Mifflin does not discriminate. Nor does it condone unhealthy dieting habits or extreme weight loss strategies. As was clearly stated in the official starting--"

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in a fat suit, speaking in his Michael Clump voice] Ohhhh! Bang! Boom! Say Clump! Why hello everybody!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Fair question.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I say, I say, I say, I say down Holly! I'll take it from here. I am beautiful. [hangs pictures of fat people on the wall, including two fat people on a bike, the Ghostbusters Marshmallow Man, Elvis, Martin Lawrence in Big Mamma's House, Jabba the Hutt, and a fat pig] They are beautiful. He is beautiful. This big fat pig is beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's my sumo suit. I just didn't inflate it all the way. I am so glad that I bought instead of rented.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Body image. We are here because there is something wrong with society.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: See, you're always saying there's something wrong with society, but... maybe there's something wrong with you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If it's me, then society made me that way. Now, I know a lot of you are probably asking yourself, "Why are you dressed in a plus sized suit?"

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Because you're kind of doing Michael Clump.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How do you know Michael Clump?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Because it's your making-fun-of-fat-people character.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How dare you! Michael Clump is a celebration of fat people.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I think of him as more like... a monster? What about, "I say, I say, I say, I'll sit on you!"

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no, it goes, it goes... look, "I say, I say, I say, I'll sit on you!"

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, NO, no! You know what? Fat people are not monsters! Why don't you guys have a little more sensitivity to the subject. Bang! Boom! Case in point! Look at the outside of this building. It is ugly. But you come inside... and it is beautiful. Just like this unappealing fat suit. Inside is a rather handsome, sexy, man.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Vamping.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Why don't you just sit down, please?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Eh, I've been sitting all day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're doing this because of you. So why don't you just go stand somewhere else. [to Ryan] Hey. Hey. You shaved?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I did.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [at a loss for words]

Quote.Speaker: Professor
Quote.Text: So, in the year 2000, fungus and even black mold was discovered growing in the cave. Some blame it on the new air conditioning system they installed. Some, on the high powered lights. [Pam's friend shows Pam a drawing mocking the professor, they laugh] Others feel that fungus is do to an over--

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to friend] Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Professor
Quote.Text: Quiet please.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Friend
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, I would like you to apologize to this beautiful, beautiful woman for forcing her to walk five miles, which for her is basically a death march.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She should thank me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok Phyllis, thank Dwight first.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Why should I have to thank him?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're right, you're right. Just, Dwight, do it. Just say it ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [exhales] I apologize for creating a ruse which forced you to exercise.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Finally. Right? Ok, Phyllis you must be exhausted from standing on those gams. Why don't you have a seat? [Phyllis sits] Let's all clap at Phyllis. [everyone claps] Ok! [in Michael Clump voice] When Michael Clump wants to remind you [normal voice] that corporate... their idea, yes, was to urge you to lose weight, but more importantly what this whole thing is about, this contest is really about being healthy. And in order to be healthy, you have to eat, Kelly. Kelly. [kneels down in front of Kelly, Dwight tries to help him down, Michael shouts gibberish at him] Kelly, I want you to stand up on your chair. Come on, stand up on your chair. Stand up, stand up, stand up. Somebody help her. Here we go. [Kelly stands up on her chair] Ok, I want you to look at her. She's a beautiful Indian woman. Why? What makes her beautiful?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [stands up] Everything. She's perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I like her nails.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, be more specific.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I like her fingernails.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I like her purple dress.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What about her looks?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hell of an ass.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: ...what else do people like?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I wonder what people like about me? ... Probably my jugs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kelly, will you just agree to stop this mess and stop trying to kill yourself?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I hate dieting, I hate it so much. I hate this worm inside of me!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to know. Kelly, look at me! I want you to know that you are beautiful. You are truly, truly beautiful. Give me a hug. [Michael hugs Kelly, his head in her chest] Mmmmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Summers going great. Just spent two hours listening to Michael Clump. I have a weird pain in my left side that I'm convinced is an ulcer. My girlfriend lives in New York and I haven't seen her in 10 days. How's your summer?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Ryan, look. Shaved off my goatee. I am goateeless. We are the goateeless brothers.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahaha, Yep! [Dwight looks down depressingly and rubs his new goatee]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: How was Friday night?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, I had a good time, but it's been three days and no call. I even have two tickets to see Counting Crows for tonight, so...

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He'll call.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oscar, enough with the girl talk please.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You guys lost four pounds.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I say we have a parade.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We better.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excellent! Good job.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So as it turns out, tonight is my nephews T-ball game and I kinda missed the first three, so...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You've already disappointed him so much. He can't be expecting a lot from you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know. I suck.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, you do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight says "Hi."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I do not! I do not say "Hi" Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Now he is saying "Hi" louder.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I... listen, umm, we're still good for this weekend, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Umm...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No football games, recitals, karate tournaments.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, can you go to IM?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: JIM9334 [screen name]
Quote.Text: Let's meet for lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you writing about me?

Quote.Speaker: Receptionitis15 [screen name]
Quote.Text: What -- today?

Quote.Speaker: JIM9334
Quote.Text: Yeah. C'mon we'll meet halfway. You'll be back for your 4 o'clock class.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm gonna write you both up for not working.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm gonna write you up for not working.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, well played. Neither of us'll write the other up for not working.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionitis15
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: JIM9334
Quote.Text: The rest stop where that soda exploded on me. Exit 17, I think. 1 o'clock.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionitis15
Quote.Text: Alright. See you there. :

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [holds up an ASCII image of Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, oh, hey. Did he call?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I just got off... Kendall? I just got off...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No no, did, I heard you talking to Oscar about that guy. What, what happened? Did he call?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Micheal
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Micheal
Quote.Text: Aach.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: And you know what? I even got two tickets to see the Counting Crows tonight as a surprise. Why do guys not call when they say they are gonna call?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I dunno. I always call everybody back right away. He'll call back though. Give him until the end of the day, he'll call. If he doesn't, he is loco.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Thanks. That's sweet. Anyways, umm, seems like we lost to Utica by only eight pounds.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Well, at least everyone lost weight. That's all that really matters.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wait, do we have until the end of the day?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: So we're only eight pounds behind Utica. Now, I know it's a stretch but we could weigh ourselves again at the end of the day and maybe win this thing after all.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Leave it to me, boss. I can get this whole office to make weight. [turns up thermostat] It's gonna be a little toasty in here. Good old fashioned sweat lodge.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Andy Bernard does not lose contests. He wins them... or he quits them because they are unfair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Kelly eating in the break room] Hey, is that healthy food?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're trying to win a contest here, Kelly. Please?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Michael. I just scheduled lunch with a client so I might be back a little late.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, that is fine. Just water, and be back by weigh-in, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sprays the inside of the vending machine with bug spray]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I hate to even ask because you have been so accommodating about all the wedding stuff.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Your wish is my command.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Is there any way our first dance can be to my favorite song, The Little Drummer Boy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Of course!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah! I mean it's a great song. I always thought it was bigger than Christmas anyway. You know?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And you know what? The guys already know it so it's easy breezy.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The guys?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I didn't tell you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mm-mm

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Here Comes Treble, class of '96 was available for our big day, so, I booked 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't think that...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And, they are collectively my best man. And they are crashing with us for three weeks, so... it totally works out.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't know if I want your old college a capella group to be our wedding band.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ok, I hear you, sweetheart, but this is a deal breaker. But you know what? You're gonna love these guys. Carl 1, Carl 2, Broccoli Rob, Spare Rib, Doobie, Lunch Box, Boner Champ, that's me, Pubie Lewis and the News, Hopscotch, Jingle Jangle, Sandwich. These are the best best-man a guy could ever hope for.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [Angela dials the phone] Let's talk about this later. [Dwight's pager buzzes]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mm-wah! [Angela walks away, Dwight follows]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey! This is not half-way! I did the math. I had to drive way longer than you. Montclair would have been closer, so you have to buy lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim gets down on one knee]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just... couldn't wait.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, will you marry me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes! [they embrace and kiss]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: God. Where is Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I'm calling it. I guess that's curtains for the yoga guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aww, really?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have to say, I think the problem with that whole thing...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...was that he was a complete stupid idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Aww man, I really wanted to see them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. I love Counting Crows.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Look at where my seats were.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, really?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's a shame. A shame to waste these. I want to buy them from you.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Michael, you don't have to buy them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do. No. I do. I, I want to. Trust me. I really do.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. Alright! [tears up tickets] Just, I want you to just forget about him, ok? Case closed. Umm, can I pay you tomorrow? I have like a 60 dollar limit on my ATM, so...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is that good?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, sorry everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What are you smiling about there smiley pants? You're late.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wet Tuna!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's up, Meredith?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dripping on me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Darryl, would you do the honors?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Two thousand one hundred seventy-five. [everyone moans] Sorry guys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nonono, no, no, I don't want to hear moaning. This is a good day. You guys accomplished something big. You lost a ton of weight, literally. A lot of weight. And I don't care what any stupid scale says. You guys are all gigantic losers.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I don't know about anyone else. But it was a good summer for me. I lost seven pounds. And you know what? I'm just gonna take five days off anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [in a hospital bed, watching Entourage in Spanish] Oh, I went zip lining my third day in Costa Rica. I guess the harness wasn't strapped in exactly right. I broke my neck. And, I've been in the hospital five weeks now. I still haven't seen the beach. It's nice to have visitors.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [to Holly] I'm doing the blood type diet.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Who gives a f[bleep]?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What'd you say h[bleep]?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Okay, great. I got it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look what just arrived from the Nashua branch. [reads from card attached to gift basket] "Here's something to enjoy on your three non-vacation days. Nashua branch." Can I send them a dead deer?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you know what we're gonna do? We're gonna take that and we are going to us it as a reward for the end of our competition.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Classy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My dream vacation? I sleep in, putter around the farm, go fishing for a few hours, take a long run in the forest, check the traps. Then the sun comes up and I head into work, which is empty, because everyone else is out of town on vacation.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [seeing Kevin throw out bunch of M&Ms] Nice job, Kevin. [Kevin fills jar back up with another candy]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm pretty fit. But in the gay community, there's a lot of pressure to be ripped. I got straight abs. I want gay abs.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Can you turn the heat down now - it's oppressive.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, totally. I'm sorry, Oscar. Yeah, I didn't realize it was bothering you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's just...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: 'Cause it's kind of bothering all of us, 'cause it's really hot, you know, it's hot, so we can lose weight, so we don't screw up this whole contest for the entire freaking office, but if you want, I'll turn it down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, hello. Hey! Your face is almost back to normal.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: One more kid calls me "Hellboy," I swear to God...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, you wish. Hellboy's a hero.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: These guys took me out on their fishing boat. I don't think I caught anything.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Have you been to the beach yet?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [on the computer] No, but I'm going zip lining tomorrow, through the, through the rainforest, with this cool couple I, I met at my hotel. Wo-woman's amazing...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Oscar! Come on, let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay, Toby, I gotta go.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, is that Michael? Does he miss me? [laughs] Uh, Oscar? Are you there? Hello? [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am suspending you without pay for the rest of the year.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, you're not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, no, I am not. Dwight! [Dwight runs into Michael's office] I want you to take Jim's chair. No! No! His chair at his desk. He gets it back on Friday.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: All right!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to get your ass out of my face.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [sitting on a stack of paper] Yeah, well, if you're only free till three on Sunday and I can't get there till one, then it's gonna be pretty tight.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [from his office] That's what she said.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [as Dwight tries to take paper out from under him] Hey, can you not?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can you not? No sitting devices, Michael's rules.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, no, no, definitely, definitely. Yes. Next weekend, then. All right! I love you, too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gah! [tries to dislodge paper with his feet]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, um, my daughter said you traded her a headband for her Nintendo DS?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, she loves that headband.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: She's six.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: She manipulates you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm gonna need you to make this right or else we can't be right.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I never know when you're kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I can't feel... I can't feel anything that you're doing, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: It's like nothing's happening.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're...you know what? I read in one of those books that you're not even supposed to give foot massages because it can induce labor.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, just stop making excuses and just dig in there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm digging.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: When Michael told us that Jan was pregnant, he led us all to believe that he was the father... by telling us he was the father. But then we got this e-mail from Jan. [waves paper and reads from it] "Hi, everyone! Jan here, writing to share some wonderful news and to quash a rumor. First, the great news - I am expecting. The beautiful baby inside me will be ready to meet the world this fall just a few months before the launch of the new Serenity by Jan line (shameless plug, I know, don't hate me, LOL). Anyway, I also wanted to clarify that the father is not anyone that you or I have ever met. Remember, no matter how excited someone is about my baby, it does not make them the father. Best, Jan. P.S. Hope to ship you something soon."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't wait to be a father. I'm going to smother that baby.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, new wicks from Craft Corner, uh, this dress [hands Michael bag] returned to Suburban Casuals, and uh, panty liners.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I really, I don't want to get panty liners, please...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well, I, you said you wanted to help, so I...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, it's...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Will you be able to milk with those implants?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You mean breastfeed?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Jan starts to get up] Easy there, old girl. [tries to help her]

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, I'm fine, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Would you just call me when you're done with the errands, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [as Jan leaves room] Careful. Hmm. She was a keeper.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want you to get the panty liners.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Done.
